<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><a name="_Current_Announcements:"></a><span

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";color:red'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpFirst style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>Have
<span class=GramE>a Happy Holidays</span>!!<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><span class=GramE>and</span> a Joyous,
Healthy, Prosperous, and Successful New Year!!<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>The
Final Exam key has been posted below, and is also available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2014-fq-cs171-old-tests/2014-fq-cs-171-final-exam-key.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>Please,
fill out your student evaluations for CS-171.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>          </span>****
Every student who fills out a course evaluation for CS-171 will receive a bonus
of 1% added to their final grade, free and clear, off the curve, simply a
bonus.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>EEE will return to me the
names of students who fill out evaluations (but not the content, which remains
anonymous), provided that enough students fill out evaluations so that
anonymity is not compromised.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I
will add 1% free bonus to the final grade of each such named student. ****<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>          </span>These
evaluations are important to UCI in monitoring our quality and success in
fulfilling our educational mission, and they are important to me in improving
the CS-171 experience.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>          </span>Knowing
what positive features you found good and strong helps me know what to repeat
and emphasize.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Many of the positive
features in the current offering of CS-171 were suggested as improvements by
previous year's students.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>          </span>Please,
fill out your student evaluations for CS-171.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>According
to the UCI Registrar quarter calendar website (<a
href="http://www.reg.uci.edu/calendars/quarterly/2014-2015/quarterly14-15.html">http://www.reg.uci.edu/calendars/quarterly/2014-2015/quarterly14-15.html</a>),
“Instruction ends” occurred yesterday, Fri., Dec 12. Consequently,
no discussion sections will occur Monday or Tuesday of next week (Dec. 15 or 16).
Instead, please schedule an office <span class=GramE>hours</span> appointment
with your TA or me by email.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>The
Quiz #4 answer key has been posted below and also is available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2014-fq-cs171-old-tests/2014-fq-cs-171-quiz-4-key.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>Please
note that <span class=GramE>P(</span>A and B) = P(A) + P(B) - P(A or B).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>If,
and only if, A and B are independent, then and only then <span class=GramE>P(</span>A
and B) = P(A)*P(B).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>If
A and B are disjoint then <span class=GramE>P(</span>A and B) = 0.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>If
A and B are synonyms (i.e., co-occur exactly) then P(A and B) = P(A) = P(B).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>ICS
has made a video of the "ICS FACULTY PANEL ON IMPROVING YOUR GRAD SCHOOL
APPLICATION<span class=GramE>" ?</span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>It
is available on YouTube (and also from the ICS website):<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>          </span>http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P50PrQ7SOuQ<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>Students
interested in grad school who were not able to attend the panel in person still
would benefit from watching the video.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span class=SpellE><span style='font-family:
"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>Sridevi</span></span><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>,
the class Reader, kindly has supplied the Quiz #1 break-down of the fraction of
students who got zero, partial, or perfect credit on each question. These
statistics have been prepended to the Quiz #1 key posted below, and also are
available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2014-fq-cs171-old-tests/2014-fq-cs-171-quiz-1-key.pdf">here</a>.
<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>The
following seminar will be of interest to students interested in machine
learning:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>“Never-Ending
Language Learning” --- the AI/ML seminar in Bren Hall 4011 from 3 to 4pm.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>Tom
M. Mitchell<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>E.
<span class=SpellE>Fredkin</span> University Professor<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>Machine
Learning Department<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>Carnegie
Mellon University<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><u><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>ABSTRACT:</span></u><span
style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'> We will never really understand the process
of learning from experience, until we can build machines that learn many
different things, over years, and become better learners over time.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>We
describe our research to build a Never-Ending Language Learner (NELL) that runs
24 hours per day, forever, learning to read the web.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Each day NELL extracts (reads) more
facts from the web, into its growing knowledge base of beliefs.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Each day NELL also learns to read better
than the day before.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>NELL has been
running 24 hours/day for over four years now. The result so far is a collection
of 70 million interconnected beliefs (e.g., <span class=SpellE>servedWtih</span>(coffee,
<span class=SpellE>applePie</span>)), NELL is considering at different levels
of confidence, along with millions of learned phrasings, morphological
features, and web page structures that NELL uses to extract beliefs from the
web. NELL is also learning to reason over its extracted knowledge, and to
automatically extend its ontology. Track NELL's progress at
http://rtw.ml.cmu.edu, or follow it on Twitter at @CMUNELL.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><u><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>BIO:</span></u><span
style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'> Tom M. Mitchell founded and chairs
the Machine Learning Department at Carnegie Mellon University, where he is the
E. <span class=SpellE>Fredkin</span> University Professor.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>His research uses machine learning to
develop computers that are learning to read the web, and uses brain imaging to
study how the human brain understands what it reads.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Mitchell is a member of the U.S.
National Academy of Engineering, a Fellow of the American Association for the
Advancement of Science (AAAS), and a Fellow and Past President of the
Association for the Advancement of Artificial Intelligence (AAAI).<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>He believes the field of machine
learning will be the fastest growing branch of computer science during the 21st
century.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><u><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>FOR
THE CURRENT SCHEDULE OF TALKS SEE:</span></u><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>
<a href="http://cml.ics.uci.edu/?page=events&subPage=aiml">http://cml.ics.uci.edu/?page=events&subPage=aiml</a><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>The
Quiz #3 key has been posted below, and also is available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2014-fq-cs171-old-tests/2014-fq-cs-171-quiz-3-key.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>Mid-term
exams will be passed out at the end of class Tues., Nov. 25, for those students
who have not yet gotten them. Otherwise, you may get them from <span
class=SpellE>Sridevi</span>, the Reader, during her office hours Wednesday
4:00-5:00pm, or anytime by appointment, in DBH-3221. The deadline for the
Mid-term Pedagogical Device is the beginning of class, Tuesday, 2 Dec. See
instructions on the new page 2 of the Exam key posted below.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>Dr.
Lathrop’s office hours for <span class=GramE>Weds.,</span> 26 Nov., are
canceled due to a death in the family.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>As
announced in lecture and on the class mailing list, the Mid-term Exam is now a
designated Pedagogical Device.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>You
can receive 50% of your missed points back by repairing the bugs in your
knowledge base that led you to miss points. The deadline for the Mid-term Pedagogical
Device has been extended to the beginning of class, Tuesday, 2 Dec. See
instructions on the new page 2 of the Exam key posted below.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>The
Reader, <span class=SpellE>Sridevi</span>, kindly has provided a break-down of
the fraction of students who got zero, partial, or perfect credit on each
question of the Mid-term Exam and Quiz #2. Quiz #1 will follow.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I have inserted this analysis as the new
page 1 of those keys posted below.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>The
Mid-term Exam key has been posted below, and also is available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2014-fq-cs171-old-tests/2014-fq-cs-171-midterm-exam-key.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>As
a suggestion, please arrive a few minutes early for the Mid-term Exam, spread
out, and take your seat quickly. Doing so will allow us to pass out the exam
quickly and give you the most possible time to work the exam.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>If
you drew a line across branch arcs instead of crossing out leaf nodes for Quiz
#2, problem #2, your answer will be considered correct if the inferred leaf
nodes to be pruned are correct. Please check your quiz if so, and ask the
Reader about any problems.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>But,
next time, please cross out the leaf nodes; it is faster and more accurate to
grade.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>A
kind and helpful student has brought it to my attention that the PDF reader on
a Mac (iPad) sometimes has difficulty reading the previous CS-171 tests
correctly. For example, in Quiz #2 from SQ’2004, problems #3a and #3b,
the erroneous “Y” on the key was corrected by an overlay in the PDF
file of a red X through the Y, and next to it a red N. However, this overlay is
invisible on a Mac (iPad), leading to incorrect understanding of the right
answer. Sometimes the Mac PDF software is incompatible with the PC PDF
software. If you are using a Mac to read the previous CS-171 test PDF files and
something looks wrong, please bring it to my attention and then look at it
again with a PC.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>A
kind and helpful student has contributed a URL for the “<a
href="https://xkcd.com/832/">Complete Map of Optimal Tic-Tac-Toe Moves.</a>”<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span

Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>A

href="http://www.thecreep.info/2014/10/google-reveals-it-is-developing.html">Google
reveals it is developing a computer so smart it can program ITSELF.</a>”<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span

</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>Dr.

style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>Several

class=GramE>COMPSCI 178.</span> <span class=GramE>Machine Learning and

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span

Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>A

which appears below in the Search material of Week 2 under “Interesting

href="http://qiao.github.io/PathFinding.js/visual/">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span

Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>Some

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span

</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>The

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>Coding

(Chapter 3, State Space Search) have been posted to the Project section below.
These shells are for students who are interested and want to have fun with the
class material, “just for fun on an optional ungraded basis.” I may

the projects.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>Please
plan to attend the <a href="grad-admissions-blurb.txt">ICS Faculty Panel on
Improving Your Grad School Application</a>, Tuesday, 21 October, noon-12:50pm
in DBH-6011.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>(If you have a time
conflict, note that the video will be posted on the ICS SAO website.)<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please review the US Bureau of Labor
Statistics chart on “<a href="../../ics-h197/us_bls_ep_chart_001_2013.jpg">Earnings
and unemployment rates by educational attainment</a>.”<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>Office
hours update: The Reader, <span class=SpellE>Sridevi</span> <span class=SpellE>Maharaj</span>,
will hold office hours Wednesday 4:00-5:00pm, or anytime by appointment, in
DBH-3221. Rick Lathrop’s office hours have changed to Wednesday

<h2><a name="_Goal:"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>Goal:</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:black'>The goal of this class is to familiarize you with the basic
principles of artificial intelligence. You will l</span><span style='font-size:
12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>earn <span style='color:black'>some
</span>basic AI techniques, the problems for which they are applicable, and
their limitations.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The
course content is organized roughly around what are often considered to be
three central pillars of AI: Search, Logic, and Learning. Topics covered
include basic search, heuristic search, game search, constraint satisfaction,
knowledge representation, logic and inference, probabilistic modeling, and machine
learning algorithms. <o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<h2><a name="_Class_Setup:"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>Class Setup:</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The
course will be primarily lecture-based.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>There will be a Mid-term and a Final Exam.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>On every second Tuesday, the first 20
minutes will be an in-class pop quiz, followed by lecture.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The frequent quizzes are intended to
encourage you to stay current with the course material.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>All exams and quizzes may cover all
material presented in class, including lectures and assigned textbook
reading.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Quizzes will cover mostly
material presented since the last quiz, and also may include questions that
many students missed on the previous quiz.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>The Final Exam will cover mostly material since the Mid-term Exam, and
also will include some questions intended to encourage you to remember the
earlier material.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Normally
I require an AI coding project, but this quarter there are 190 enrolled
students and I have been assigned only one Reader, so it is not logistically
feasible.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>If any students are
interested in doing an AI coding project “just for fun” then I will
make the coding project shells available (you have to write the
“smarts” that goes into the shell).<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I have shells for constraint
satisfaction (Sudoku), game playing/adversarial search (Connect-K), and
heuristic search (path finding in a maze). All these shells were written by
former CS-171 students who became interested in AI and signed up for CS-199 in
order to pursue their interest and write interesting AI project shells.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please let me know if this is of
interest to you (CS-171 grade of A- or better required).<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Homework
will be assigned, but is not graded. The reason is that prior student course
evaluations alerted me to the existence of student cheating by way of copying
the homework answers.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I deplore
this degree of personal degradation in dishonest students, but I cannot control
it, and so I avoid the opportunity.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>I remain determined to create a fair and honest educational experience
for all students, as best I can.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:black'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=left>

</span></h2>

<h2><a name="_Textbook"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>Textbook</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:red'>Required:</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:black'><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Russell & <span class=SpellE><span class=GramE>Norvig</span></span><span
class=GramE> :</span> Artificial Intelligence; A Modern Approach, 3<sup>rd</sup>
edition.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>The
course is based on, and the UCI bookstore has, the 3<sup>rd</sup> edition. The
assigned textbook reading is required, and is fair game for quizzes and
exams.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span></span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>You place
yourself at a distinct disadvantage if you do not have the textbook.</span></b><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I expect that you have a personal copy
of the textbook, and quizzes and exams are written accordingly.</span></b><span
style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>Please
purchase or rent your own personal textbook for the quarter (and then resell it
back to the UCI Bookstore at the end if you don't want it for reference).</span>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='color:red'>Please do not
jeopardize your precious educational experience with the false economy of
trying to save a few dollars by not having a personal copy of the textbook.</span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>Also, for
your convenience, I have requested that a copy of the textbook be placed on
reserve in the UCI Science Library.</span><strong><span style='font-weight:
normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> There is a two-hour check-out limit. </span></strong>However,
please understand that with high student enrollments, it is unrealistic to
expect that these thin reserves will always be available when you need
them.  <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='color:red'>Please
purchase or rent your own personal textbook.</span></b><strong><span
style='color:red;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></strong></p>

<p><strong><span style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow;font-weight:
normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>I do deplore the high cost of textbooks.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>You are likely to find the book cheaper
if you search online at EBay.com, Amazon.com, and related sites.<o:p></o:p></span></strong></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>Standard Sudoku is
played on a 9x9 grid subdivided into nine 3x3 boxes. Every row, column, and box
must contain the digits 1 through 9 exactly once. Monster (or Mega) Sudoku is
similar, but the grid and boxes are bigger. 12x12 puzzles are played with the
numbers 1 to 12 (or 1 to 9 and A, B, and C) in each row, column, and 3x4 box.
16x16 puzzles are played with 1 to 16 (or 1 to 9 and the letters A to G) in
each row, column, and 4x4 box. In general, <span class=SpellE>NxN</span>
puzzles are played with the numbers 1 to N (or 1 to 9 and the letters A to Z)
and <span class=SpellE>pxq</span> boxes, where N = <span class=SpellE><span
class=GramE>pq</span></span>. Sometimes zero is added to the digits. The Sudoku
community has developed many clever variants and encodings based on this
general idea.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>A former CS-171 student

<p class=MsoNormal><span class=MsoHyperlink><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>Maze
Solver:</span></b><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>This project corresponds to Informed Search Problems (Chapter 3 in your
book). Your job is to write an AI agent that can find paths through a maze better
than you can.</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>You are employed by a company that
makes interactive video games. The game's 2D world has a large number of fixed
polygonal obstacles of various shapes and sizes on the screen. You are assigned
to write the controller for one of the moving figures on the screen. Whenever a
gold coin appears on the screen, your figure is to walk to the coin as rapidly
as possible, avoiding all obstacles. Input is the screen locations of your
figure, the gold coin, and the locations and shapes of all obstacles. Output is
to be the path your figure will follow to the coin. [<a
href="../../AI-projects/maze-solver/maze-experts-on-hardest-mazes.pdf">Click
here for solved examples.</a>]<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>This is the same basic problem as
robot navigation through a crowded workspace without colliding with any objects
in the workspace. In general, this problem is representative of a whole class
of related planning and navigation problems.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Demonstrate, benchmark, and compare
Breadth-First, Depth-First, Uniform Cost, Bidirectional (using Uniform-Cost),
Iterative Deepening, Greedy Best First, and A* search on this route-finding
problem.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>The coding resources include:<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>(1) <a
href="../../AI-projects/maze-solver/JavaPolygon.zip">A Java shell</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>(2) <a
href="../../AI-projects/maze-solver/CppPolygon.zip">A C++ shell</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>(3) <a
href="../../AI-projects/maze-solver/game.exe">An example game</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>(4) <a
href="../../AI-projects/maze-solver/maze-experts-on-hardest-mazes.pdf">Examples
of maze agents in mazes</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>(5) Test mazes (to appear soon).<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I will give Bonus Points to students who
contribute difficult mazes (should be harder than the mazes here).<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>It is easy to prove to yourself that
the shortest path through a maze must be a sequence of straight line segments
from polygon corner to polygon corner (apply the Triangle Inequality). The
shell is set up to facilitate finding such a solution.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Clever students have discovered that
the <span class=SpellE>isVisible</span> function is buggy, in the sense that it
is only correct for polygon corners, and sometimes allows a search path to
“tunnel through” a polygon if a candidate point is placed in the
interior of a polygon (<a
href="../../AI-projects/maze-solver/buggy-test-case-1.png">example 1</a>; <a
href="../../AI-projects/maze-solver/buggy-test-case-2.png">example 2</a>).<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Such paths are not considered valid

<h2><a name="_Study_Guides_---"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
"Arial","sans-serif";color:red'>Study Guides --- Previous CS-171 Quizzes,
Mid-term, and Final exams:</span><span class=MsoHyperlink><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:windowtext;
font-weight:normal;text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Previous
CS-171 Quizzes, Mid-term exams, and Final exams are available here as study
guides.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>As an
incentive to study this material, at least one question from a previous Quiz or
Exam will appear on every new Quiz or Exam. In particular, questions that many
students missed are likely to appear again. If you missed a question, please
study it carefully and learn from your mistake --- so that if it appears again,
you will understand it perfectly. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Also, a
student has recommended ‘quizlet.com’ as a good online study
resource. While I cannot vouch for it, apparently it contains several good
study aids for your textbook.</span><span class=MsoHyperlink><span
style='color:windowtext;text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<h2><a name="_Academic_Honesty:"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
"Arial","sans-serif";color:red'>Academic Honesty: </span><span
class=MsoHyperlink><span style='color:windowtext;text-decoration:none;
text-underline:none'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Academic dishonesty is unacceptable
and will not be tolerated at the University of California, Irvine. It is the
responsibility of each student to be familiar with UCI's current academic
honesty policies. Please take the time to read the current <a
href="http://www.senate.uci.edu/senateweb/default2.asp?active_page_id=754">UCI
Senate Academic Honesty Policies</a> and the <a
href="https://www.ics.uci.edu/ugrad/policies/index.php#academic_honesty">ICS
School Policy on Academic Honesty</a>.</span></b></p>

<p><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>The
policies in these documents will be adhered to scrupulously. Any student who
engages in cheating, forgery, dishonest conduct, plagiarism, or collusion in
dishonest activities, will receive an academic evaluation of ``F'' for the
entire course, with a letter of explanation to the student's permanent file.
The <a href="http://www.ics.uci.edu/grad/sao/index.php">ICS Student Affairs
Office</a> will be involved at every step of the process. Dr. Lathrop seeks to
create a level playing field for all students.</span></b></p>
